metadata.title: CVE-2020-6513 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap buffer overflow in PDFium in Google Chrome prior to 84.0.4147.89allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via acrafted PDF file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6513` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 84.0.4147.105-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 84.0.4147.105-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 84.0.4147.105-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 84.0.4147.105-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 84.0.4147.105-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '84.0.4147.105-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
